body.p: To His Excellency Thos. E Bramlette. Gov of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

Your petitioner Moses Moore humbly prays a hearing of his complaint and that your Excellency may grant his petition. He says some time since he was bound over to keep the peace in the sum of $200. That since said time he has been a quiet & peacable citizen. That a few days since he was fined, in the Lexington City Court, five dollars for a breach of the peace. That though he complaineth not of this judgement. he feels he was not entirely responsible for said breach & violation of law. But it was adjudged he had forfeited his bond to keep the peace. and that it would be a very great hardship for him to pay the said $200. That he is a poor man & with a large familly. they are dependent on him for their maintenance. That the payment of this sum would embarrass him greatly & work an injury to his family Wherefore he prays your Excellency to remit said forfeiture & relieve him & family from such injury & embarrasment.

G. Clay Goodloe
C. T Worley
H B Barclay
B W Blincoe
D, L, Price
J. B. Norton
John T. Miller
W C Goodloe
W D Boswell
Wm Van Pelt, Jr
E V Reynolds.
W. O Goodloe
M B Johnson
O A Reynolds
